business.headline: From ATM charges to LPG prices: 5 key financial changes to know in May 2025Starting May 1, taking cash out from an ATM after your free monthly limit will cost you Rs 23 per transaction, up from the current Rs 21.
Zomato Q4 earnings: What to expect from Eternal's January-March resultsAnalysts expect mixed numbers for the fourth quarter, mainly due to expected higher losses from its quick commerce arm, Blinkit.

'Gold doesn't always glitter': This CA's post might change your mindA CA pointed out a combination of global shocks, like COVID-19, wars, inflation fears, and central bank purchases, which all contributed to the price spike in the yellow metal since 2020.

'Deliberately false': Elon Musk slams report claiming Tesla looking to replace himElon Musk responded furiously on X, calling it "an EXTREMELY BAD BREACH OF ETHICS" and slamming the WSJ for "publishing a DELIBERATELY FALSE ARTICLE" despite receiving a prior denial from Tesla's board.

Vedanta Q4 profit more than doubles: Check price target, FY26 estimates and moreWith expansion projects nearing completion and deleveraging underway, analysts believe Vedanta is positioning itself for a stronger, leaner phase of growth.

New ITR Forms 1 and 4 notified for FY 2024-2025. Check key changes, who can fileITR-1, or Sahaj, is for resident individuals who have an overall income of not more than Rs 50 lakh a year and the income is from a salary or pension, single house property, or income like interest from bank deposits or fixed deposits.

Ather Energy IPO: Step-by-step guide to check allotment status. See latest GMPThe electric scooter maker's public offer was just fully subscribed by the end of the final day of bidding, suggesting investors were not keen to put their money on another EV scooter maker, after Ola Electric's shares have not performed well since its market debut.

Accounting lapse, high-profile exits: What's next for IndusInd Bank?As the dust settles on IndusInd Bank's derivatives debacle, the real test begins: can the bank restore trust, steady the ship, and convince investors it's back on course?

Coca-Cola sells record servings at Maha Kumbh. The final number may shock youWhile saints and seekers looked for divine blessings, the world's biggest beverage giant looked across the Ganga's banks and found its biggest crowd.

Sensex, Nifty holiday: Are stock markets open for trading today?There are also no market holidays in the months of June and July 2025, so investors can expect uninterrupted trading during this period.

After Mother Dairy, Amul hikes milk prices by Rs 2 per litreAfter Mother Dairy, Amul has also hiked the prices of its milk up to 2rs per litre. The new prices will come into effect from tomorrow, i.e., May 1.

'Cash is king,' says Mark Mobius amid trade war fears, backs India over ChinaVeteran investor Mark Mobius believes that the uncertainty around the trade wars makes it risky to invest right now. However, he does see hope in countries like India, which he says could benefit as global supply chains shift away from China.

entertainment.headline: HIT 3 X review: Audience calls Nani's film sensational and stylish, see postsHIT 3 X reviews: Nani's action entertainer has made the audience go bonkers on social media. Several viewers like the actor's style, and the ruthless cop avatar in the third film from the franchise.

Shanaya Kapoor's Ankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan to be monsoon entertainer, release date outShanaya Kapoor is all set to make her Bollywood debut alongside Vikrant Massey in the romantic film, 'Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan', releasing on July 11th, 2025. The motion poster was released earlier this year.

Exclusive: Lewis Pullman, Hannah John-Kamen call Thunderbolts 'indie' Marvel filmMarvel Studios' 'Thunderbolts' is set to be an emotionally deep and grounded film in the MCU, exploring the psychological depths of anti-heroes and villains. Directed by Jake Schreier, the film features a unique tone and aims to resonate deeply with the audience.

Tom Cruise pilots helicopter to fly rumoured girlfriend Ana de Armas to LondonHollywood superstar Tom Cruise personally flew Ana de Armas to London for her 37th birthday. The videos shared online seemingly confirmed their relationship.

The Bhootnii review: A virgin tree, love curse, and lot of nonsenseReleased-Thu May 01, 2025In the film 'The Bhootnii', Sanjay Dutt and Sunny Singh deliver a lackluster performance in a horror-comedy that fails to amuse or engage audiences. Despite its attempt at blending romance and supernatural elements, the film ends up as an uninspired two-hour ordeal.

PM Modi will bring peace in Kashmir: Rajinikanth at WAVES Summit 2025Superstar Rajinikanth thanked PM Narendra Modi during his speech at the WAVES Summit 2025. He also mentioned the Pahalgam terrorist attack, and said he trusts the Prime Minister to restore glory and peace in the Valley.

Neha Kakkar shares post after fresh claims emerge in Melbourne concert controversyNeha Kakkar made a fresh post amid fresh claims from the organisers of her Melbourne concert. The singer supported her brother Tony Kakkar's new song, but wrote something which appeared a little cryptic. The post comes amid ongoing allegations that she lied about the reasons behind delays at the event.

Exclusive: Girl group W.i.S.H wants to collaborate with Jungkook, Dua LipaW.i.S.H, India's first girl group in 22 years, is making waves with their unique blend of Indian and global music styles, aiming to carve out a space in the international pop scene. The band discusses their journey, challenges, and aspirations in an exclusive interview

Deepika-Ranveer have a 'good time' at dinner with Instagram Head Adam MosseriPower couple Deepika Padukone and Ranveer Singh stepped out for a dinner night with Instagram head Adam Mosseri in Mumbai last night. Adam also shared a post featuring the couple expressing gratitude.

Chhaava actor Viineet Kumar Singh to welcome first child with wife RuchiraActor Viineet Kumar Singh, popular for his roles in 'Chhaava' and 'Superboys of Malegaon', is all set to welcome his first child with wife Ruchira Singh.

Raid 2 movie review: Ajay Devgn's film crumbles under weight of his stardomReleased-Thu May 01, 2025In 'Raid 2', you never get to meet Amay Patnaik, the honest income tax officer, because Ajay Devgn never gives in to the character. He appears like both Singham and Vijay Salgaonkar in parts, and drives a half-baked story.

Ajith Kumar turns 54, wife Shalini shares old pics from race-themed birthday bashAjith Kumar is celebrating his 54th birthday on May 1. His wife, Shalini, shared throwback photos from the race-themed birthday bash she hosted in 2024.

Ajith shares story of becoming 'accidental actor': Took up job to pay my debtsAjith Kumar, one of the celebrated superstars of Tamil cinema, called himself an 'accidental actor' in an exclusive conversation with India Today. He explained the story of how he took up acting to pay his debts from a failed business.

WAVES 2025 to kick off today in Mumbai, PM Modi to inaugurateWAVES 2025 will commence on May 1 in Mumbai. Set to be inaugurated by PM Modi, the four-day event will witness a plethora of keynote speakers from various walks of life.

Pope Francis's final interview to feature in Scorsese's film 'Aldeas — A New Story'Martin Scorsese is producing Aldeas — A New Story, a documentary focused on Pope Francis's Aldeas initiative, featuring youth films promoting cultural dialogue, as well as the Pope's final interview before his death.

Who is David Corenswet? Meet the actor playing the new SupermanDavid Corenswet, once a rising Netflix star, is now cast as James Gunn's new Superman. From humble beginnings to donning the cape, his journey marks a fresh era for DC films.

Instagram accounts of several Pak actors including Hania Aamir's blocked in IndiaOther Pakistani celebrities whose Instagram accounts have been disabled in India are Ali Zafar, Sanam Saeed, Bilal Abbas, Iqra Aziz, Imran Abbas and Sajal Aly.

Ajith opens up about his passion for acting: I have very strong work ethicsAjith Kumar, celebrated actor and racer, shared insights on his dual passions - acting and racing - in an exclusive interview. Recently awarded the Padma Bhushan, he reflected on his journey and future racing plans.

Janhvi Kapoor fumes over Jaipur drunk-driving accident that killed 14-year-oldA tragic incident in Jaipur unfolded as a 14-year-old girl lost her life due to a drunk-driving accident, prompting actor Janhvi Kapoor to express her outrage on social media. The accident involved a car allegedly driven by an intoxicated woman.

general news.headline: Don't demoralise the forces: Supreme Court refuses to hear Pahalgam attack pleaThe petition sought the formation of a judicial commission to investigate the terror attack in Pahalgam's Baisaran valley that left 26 dead.

Pahalgam terrorists still holed up in Kashmir, very self-reliant: NIA sourcesSources said that during the attack on April 22 in Pahalgam's Baisaran valley, there were suspicions of additional terrorists maintaining a distance, possibly to provide cover-fire in case security forces attempted a rapid response.

India allows Pakistanis to leave until further orders, but Pak yet to open gatesThe order by the Home Ministry modifies its previous direction that said the Attari-Wagah border would be closed on April 30.

The 1989 un-Islamic kidnapping and chaos in the valleyIn part 4 of our series on the history of terrorism in Kashmir, we revisit the December 1989 kidnapping of Rubaiya Sayeed that encouraged thousands to hit the streets and bring the Indian government to its knees.

Hafiz Saeed gets 4X security after J&K attack, Pak army deployed: SourcesThe Pakistan Army, ISI, and Lashkar operatives are jointly overseeing Hafiz Saeed's protection, sources said, adding that drone surveillance has been deployed to monitor the compound, while roads within a 4-kilometre radius have been equipped with high-resolution CCTV cameras.

CRPF jawan's Pakistani wife on deportation bus gets last-minute reliefMinal Khan from Pakistan's Punjab met and married a CRPF jawan from India online. She came to Jammu on a short-term visa, which expired on March 22. Minal was among the Pakistanis asked to leave after the Pahalgam terror attack, but won a last-minute court reprieve. The case has raised eyebrows.

India deploys jammers to block Pakistan aircraft navigation systems: SourcesThe Indian jamming systems are capable of interfering with multiple satellite-based navigation platforms, including GPS (US), GLONASS (Russia), and Beidou (China)-all of which are used by Pakistani military craft, sources said.

He appears like both Singham and Vijay Salgaonkar in parts, and drives a half-baked story.

Terrorists recced 3 Pahalgam spots, tight security foiled attack at park: SourcesA week before the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 people, mostly tourists, on April 22, terrorists had conducted reconnaissance of three locations in the area on April 15, sources said.

Bizarre error sneaks into Bengal govt's Jagannath temple adA navigation map in a double-spread advertisement on the Jagannath temple in Digha issued by the West Bengal government and carried across India by newspapers had an embarrassing mistake. A location on the map read 'Female Vibrators in Digha'. The Pran Pratishtha ceremony of the Jagannathdham in Digha took place on April 30 in the presence of CM Mamata Banrjee. The temple has been seen as an outreach to Hindus.

Rubio dials S Jaishankar, Shehbaz Sharif: India, Pak should de-escalate tensionsUS Secretary of State Marco Rubio spoke with Indian External Affairs Minister Dr S Jaishankar and Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif amid rising tensions following the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 people.

India's Shubhanshu Shukla to study how astronauts lose muscle in spaceAs the pilot for Ax-4 mission, scheduled to likely launch in May, Shukla's journey signifies a monumental step in India's space exploration plans.

Live: NIA chief visits Pahalgam terror site as attack probe intensifiesPahalgam attack live updates: Today marks the 9th day since the deadly Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26 people, mostly tourists. India is weighing options for retaliation beyond the sweeping diplomatic and strategic countermeasures already taken against Pakistan. These measures include the effective downgrading of diplomatic ties, closure of key border routes, suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, and expulsion of Pakistani military attaches from its High Commission in New Delhi. On Wednesday, Prime Minister Modi held a series of back-to-back key cabinet meetings. On Tuesday, he granted the Indian Armed Forces "complete operational freedom" to respond to the Pahalgam terror attack.

Caste census gamble: Is Modi's Mandal 2.0 a bold reform or ballot strategy?The move to conduct a caste census comes months before elections in politically crucial states like Bihar and has ignited a tug-of-war between the BJP-led NDA and the Opposition over who deserves credit for the decision.

Delhi vs. Bengaluru vs. Mumbai: How cities regulate private school fees differentlyThe move comes in response to a recent vigilance report showing that several schools in Delhi had increased fees arbitrarily and even retrospectively, placing an unfair burden on parents.

Dubai agency's job posting for house manager with Rs 84 lakh salary goes viralThe job posting shared by Royal Maison, a premier domestic staffing and private recruitment boutique headquartered in Dubai, has gone viral on social media.

Even Nehru...: BJP counters Rahul Gandhi's 'welcome' reply to caste censusDharmendra Pradhan said Jawaharlal Nehru was against the idea and had described caste reservation as "anti-progress", accusing the Congress of having historically resisted efforts to empower marginalised communities.

Flying hours, operation costs: How India shutting airspace will impact PakistanIndia closed its airspace to all aircraft registered, operated, or leased by Pakistan-including commercial airlines and military flights - from April 30 to May 23, 2025. The airspace ban is seen as a tit-for-tat response amid rising tensions following the deadly Pahalgam terror attack that left 26 people dead.

High alert along Bangladesh border as Pak's ISI increases footprint: SourcesThe agencies have been told to be extra-vigilant along the Bangladesh border in view of the increasing presence of Pakistan's ISI and Pakistani military officials there.

sports.headline: Punjab Kings star Glenn Maxwell ruled out of IPL 2025 due to finger fracturePunjab Kings' Australian all-rounder Glenn Maxwell was ruled out of the remainder of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 season due to a fractured finger.

I'm too stupid to answer that question: Iga Swiatek shuts down journalistFive-time Grand Slam champion Iga Swiatek found herself in an awkward position after a journalist asked her a question in the press conference after her Madrid Open quarterfinal against Madison Keys.

Yuzvendra Chahal explains his IPL hattrick heroics vs CSKAfter taking his second IPL hattrick, Yuzvendra Chahal revealed that he relied on his instincts and tweaked his line during their IPL clash against Chennai Super Kings.

Women's T20 World Cup 2026 in England to start on June 12The Women's T20 World Cup 2026 is scheduled to take place from June 12 to July 5. 33 matches will take place across 24 days in seven venues. Lord's will host the grand finale.

Mumbai Indians sign Raghu Sharma as replacement for injured Vignesh PuthurMumbai Indians spinner Vignesh Puthur was ruled out of the remainder of the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025 due to injury. The MI team management have signed Raghu Sharma as a replacement for the injured Vignesh Puthur.

Shreyas Iyer penalised for slow over rate against Chennai Super KingsIPL 2025, CSK vs PBKS: Punjab Kings' skipper Shreyas Iyer was fined Rs 12 lakh of his match fees after the four-wicket win over the Chennai Super Kings on Wednesday at the Chepauk.

Punjab Kings coach explains delay in signing injury replacementsPunjab Kings head coach Ricky Ponting has explained the delay in signing injury replacements, saying that the schedule clash with PSL has limited the availability of quality options. The team has been dealing with key injuries, as Glenn Maxwell fractured his finger during a training session ahead of the rain-abandoned match against Kolkata Knight Riders on April 26, while Lockie Ferguson has been ruled out for the season due to a serious injury.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
